title: Masaaki Kato
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Kato was born in <a href="Nagoya">Nagoya</a> on December 22, 1958. After graduating from <a href="Hosei%20University">Hosei University</a>, he joined <a href="Japan%20Soccer%20League">Japan Soccer League</a> Division 2 club <a href="Hokkaido%20Consadole%20Sapporo">Toshiba</a> in 1981. The club won <a href="1981%20JSL%20Cup">1981 JSL Cup</a>. However he left the club for injury in 1983. In 1985, he joined Division 1 club <a href="Yokohama%20Fl%C3%BCgels">All Nippon Airways</a>.
National team career.
On August 30, 1981, Kato debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Malaysia%20national%20football%20team">Malaysia</a>. On September 3, he scored a goal against <a href="India%20national%20football%20team">India</a>. He played 3 games and scored 1 goal for Japan in 1981.
